cons: Company grew too fast and care for clients and employees suffered. Leadership detached from staff. Promotes people with zero experience, and passes over people who deserve promotion. Zero loyalty. Good pay and benefits are a way to distract people while they work them to death. I was there for over five years and miserable.

review_title: Not compemsated based on merit or experience
pros: I can't think of any at this time
cons: Doesn't matter if you have 10 years or 1 month of experience. You WILL be paid the same flat rate of 55K/yr. which is somewhat insulting. They advertise salaries that are not straight salary. No, it includes impossible to meet metrics based on client performance, daily census and constantly moving goal posts. Nuway also was offering $25 Gift Cards if employees would post 5 star reviews on Indeed, etc. so that the more honest reviews are diluted out with ones that are paid shills. You do not have job security, in the lower census periods staff can be laid off or dropped in FTE hours. For a non-profit, this agency works more like the For-Profit treatment centers that focus on quantity, not quality.

review_title: Bring your Hazmat suit because this is a toxic work environment
pros: Coworkers are passionate and you will trauma bond with them. The clients are great. The compensation is decent.
cons:
NUWAY is a fantastic example of how everything flows from leadership. You have a great model, passionate employees and plenty of people in need to help. Okay, sounds like a recipe for a really special work environment where lots of people can be helped. Except you have management that aren't supportive, they don't listen and seem to enjoy creating unnecessary stress for their employees.

I've seen and experiencing first hand gaslighting attempts by managers. It's always fun when you get express permission to do something and then later get reprimanded by the person who gave you the permission and their boss where you feel like you're in an interrogation and when you can produce the e-mails to show you're right they get offended.

The worst part is you have to show up everyday in that insanity and then try to model for you clients healthy behaviors. I suppose it is a great opportunity for the therapist or counselor to practice coping skills.

review_title: Unless it's  temporary, don't do it.
